name: Arelith Sword Master: (Fighter 10/ Rogue 4/ Weapon Master 16)
author: Valerfor

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
This is a very high AB & Damage build with all the welcoming rogue perks, such as UMD, trap-finding/ trap-setting, evasion and others. He should do very well in all kind of environments as long as you protect his low will save. I typically always carry a stack of clarity potions for such cases and never had any kind of problems, at long as i knew the ground before me. The build doesn't have intermediate rogue levels between the fourth and twenty-sixth ones, but that is necessary in order to maximize bonus feats and achieve four great strengths as was my goal.

posts.author: TychoVelius
posts.content: My only question is if you're allowed that one-level Rogue blip at 27, since Arelith requires three consecutive levels for all classes taken.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Yup! Since I took the first three levels (the magic number for Arelith) as a rogue, then I can place the fourth in whatever order I like and the best place for it is the 27th level in order to score exactly 30 ranks in tumble for maximum AC benefits.

posts.author: TychoVelius
posts.content:
Awesome.

Weapon is open to alteration, provided it doesn't require squeezing in an Exotic proficiency, yes?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
That's right.

Greataxe, halberd, greatsword or any one-handed weapon such as the scimitar or Warhammer will be fine.

Thanks for catching that up, haven't looked into that build for quite a while.

I moved Blind-Fight & all combat feats three levels earlier in the build's order and finished at level eighteen with Great Fortitude to boost the saves a bit. The low Will save is still the one nick in the defences of that build but that's what clarity potions (and scrolls of lesser mind-blank) are for, I guess.

Or you could shuffle the feats a bit & make this a brutal Scythe-master X5 Criticals...

Can't be done in thirty levels,
